Posts.Content: I was lucky my family bought me clothes or gave me money so that was good as I'm a single mum I bought my own xmas presents from the kids which included iphone which I thought would be useful during chemo, don't laugh but I also bought myself a hairdryer which will be no use during chemo lol so I bought a stupid present for myself. Kiera
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hi Im due for chemo the week after next and It doesnt take much for me to feel sick I am thinking of taking some anti sickness tablets before I go for my first chemo so they can get into my system. All the best with your treatment Kiera
Posts.Title: First FEC chemo

Posts.Content: My ONC told me after having chemo for the next five days that I will have to inject myself at home I nearly collapsed through the floor don't mind needles but couldnt do it to myself. Not sure which I'm dreading the most the chemo or me injecting myself
Posts.Title: First FEC chemo

Posts.Content: Thankyou ladies My ex partner has been there for me all the way he told me if I really can't manage them that he will do them for me and as hes a diabetic he knows what he is doing.  I should be grateful I'm getting them and where I do them is numb from my c section so even better. All the best hope you all feel better soon Kiera x
Posts.Title: First FEC chemo

Posts.Content: I am 16 months since I finished chemo and now half of my toenail has come and some of it looks discoloured with ridges, I would have tht I wouldn't be having any side effects of chemo after  all this time.
Posts.Title: 16 months post chemo and still nails coming off

Posts.Content: I meant toenail has come off
Posts.Title: 16 months post chemo and still nails coming off

Posts.Content: Hi Trudi E Thank you and I am so sorry that you haven't been very well and here is me going on about losing one toe nail.  I wish you all the best and hope you start to feel a bit better soon. All the best take care Tracey
Posts.Title: 16 months post chemo and still nails coming off

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies for your replies it's surprising how long chemo effects do last.  I did paint my nails and were fine during chemo it was after chemo had finished some of them fell off, although finger nails look quite good now. All the best ladies Tracey
Posts.Title: 16 months post chemo and still nails coming off

Posts.Content: Went to the dentist the other day now she reakons that I need a biopsy on a little lump on the roof of my mouth that has been there years without changing, the only reason it is there is because my denture is there.  Crikey as if its not bad enough me getting paranoid without others starting. Tracey
Posts.Title: I don't believe it

Posts.Content: Thanks have been waiting over 2 weeks for appt already
Posts.Title: I don't believe it

Posts.Content: Hi MalH I am in a similar situation I've got my sentinel node biopsy on Thurs to find out if my cancer has gone to the nodes mine is also in the right breast near the nipple so I am going to have a mastectomy not looking forward to that especially if it has gone to my nodes as I won't be able to have reconstruction straight away. I totally understand how you feel its hard to stay positive I know I'm going to be a nervous wreck waiting for the results. All the best hope you feel a bit better soon. Kiera
Posts.Title: hoping to find some comfort from people who understand

Posts.Content: Hi Helena Thank you so much for wishing me good luck.  The surgeon told me that I might not need any hormone treatment as I'm only 46 and I'm hoping that I will be lucky enough to get away without having to have rad or chemo but we will see. Its nice being able to still go to the gym and they have told me I can still do taekwondo as long as I don't do any sparring so thats good as it is a good stress relief. I am so pleased that you are doing so well. Hugs x Kiera
Posts.Title: hoping to find some comfort from people who understand

Posts.Content: I have never found out what cancer I had they didn't tell me.  They only told me that it was hormone positive when I asked if I had to have hormone treatment. Not sure if I want to know now though
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Hi I am going to see plastic surgeon on Wedsday (can't wait) I am having it taken off my tummy to make my boob not too sure what its called.  After seeing the BCN she told me that I will after stay in hospital for a week and that I won't be able to get out of bed for 3 days just wondered if this is right. She also told me it takes a couple of months to recover from it but was hoping to be back at work in a couple of weeks, any comments would be appreciated. Many thanks Tracey x
Posts.Title: ld flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Yes I've been to one keeping abreast meeting in kings lynn, also had a meeting with plastic surgeon ages ago as they thought they would be able to do immediate reconstruction after mx but then they discovered it had gone to my nodes so have had to wait.  The one I am seeing is Miss Ali she is really nice I know who you mean but can't remember his name he is supposed to be really good.
Posts.Title: ld flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi I had Ld flap with expander four weeks ago was in hospital for 5 days was on morphine pump but only used it once it made me sick so found Ibuprofen was good enough for the pain.  I am really pleased with the results my arm is a bit stiff but can get it above my head now and starting to be able to walk without getting wiped out.  Kids are finding out that housework doesnt do itself lol as not allowed to do some household tasks will be glad when I can drive again.  I find if i do too much that my back aches but apart from that I feel good.
Posts.Title: what reconstruction to have

Posts.Content: Hi It looks like we are having the same procedure as DIEP flap construction sounds about right, although I have got appointment at Kings Lynn they say I will have to go to Norwich for the op, the BCN has told me that the waiting time is 18 weeks It will be interesting to see how we get on Tracey x
Posts.Title: ld flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Thank you ladies for the info I want a DIEP reconstruction but am slightly put off by the length of the op and also the long recovery time, I was hoping to have op and be back working in 4 weeks but I don't think thats going to happen. Tracey
Posts.Title: ld flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: I am starting RADS tomorrow a bit nervous as I don't like anything too close to me but everyone says its nothing to worry about hopefully will feel better after the first one
Posts.Title: Start RADS on monday

Posts.Content: Thankyou ladies
Posts.Title: Start RADS on monday

Posts.Content: Hi I've had mx and anc and at the moment are on day 2 of second fec So I've only got one more fec to go I've learnt if you have problems with chemo don't just leave it like I did last time because they can sort it.  Got to have rads and hormone therapy after chemo. Hope all goes well Kiera x
Posts.Title: Dcis treatment

Posts.Content: I had my last TAX today hopefully the reduced dose will help with side effects.  All the best for Thurs will be thinking about you.  It feels a bit surreal all finished with chemo. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Hi I am having my final TAX tomorrow not looking forward to it as I ended up in hospital for 3 days last time, so onc has reduced my dose so hopefully  that will do the trick fingers x. All the best everyone Tracey x
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: While I am looking forward to my mx next week I am not sure how I am going to feel about losing my right boob.  How did other people feel about this was it easier or harder than they were expecting
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: Thankyou ladies Its nice to talk to people who know exactly how you are feeling I kept thinking its got to be everywhere and really stressing but now I seemed to have turned a corner and am ok about it at the moment.  Can't wait to get this cancer out of me now but its not long till tues then I finally get rid of it thank god. Hopefully I will be ok about losing one as I am 36B so should be able to get new prosthesis would have loved to have been able to get reconstruction at the same time but more important to get rid of all of it and will get reconstruction sometime in the future. Gud luck Karen for your new boob job I wish getting one in January but will get there sometime. Huggs to all of you
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: Now had my mx operation wasnt as bad as I thought will be good when I can get rid of my drain then will feel a lot better.  I think it will be a shock when I have my first bath but I'm ready for that so glad I've got rid of it.
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: I am ok thankyou I only needed pain killers for first couple of days I can't wait until I have the drain out will feel a lot better then.  Its not as bad as I thought get my results next thursday on my lymph nodes that he has removed but am over one hurdle now on to the next one. Kiera
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: I'm dreading the results of my sentinel node biopsy tomorrow morning my initial surgeon said that he didn't think it had gone to my nodes but I needed a sentinel node biopsy to be sure but I know they can be wrong.  Hopefully will get some good results that would be a nice present for xmas fingers x
Posts.Title: OMG Sentinel Biopsy results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies for your comments hopefully I will just be glad to get this cancer out but I am so worried at the moment for some reason its really stressing me out keep having panic attacks.  I knoiw people who have had cancer and recovered and they are telling me not to worry but I can't help it.
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: Hi Topcat Yes I do feel better after reading all the comments they were really helpful its nice people on here being so supportive.  Was feeling really sick earlier but my friend came and took me out for a meal and then I was ok had some retail therapy. Thankyou so much Topcat for your comments they make me feel that it mite not be too bad and definately going to have to kick cancers butt. Thankyou so much will let you know how I get on Hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: Thankyou Helena glad you are feeling fine on Rads and I bet its nice to get to the gym as well.  I am going to go to the gym on Thurs whatever the results hopefully will be able to have a gud run on the treadmill but we will see. I am taking someone with me tomorrow and maybe a book to read to take my mind of it perhaps I should promise myself a little treat afterwards.  Thanks for your advice. Hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: OMG Sentinel Biopsy results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for your good wishes hopefully I will be posting some good news tomorrow.
Posts.Title: OMG Sentinel Biopsy results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi I am a size 10 and my surgeon has told me that I don't have enough fat for TRAM or DIEP flap and that she will only do ld flap. All the best hope you get on ok Tracey
Posts.Title: Reconstruction.....help please

Posts.Content: Hi Welcome to this site where no one wants to be but you will get loads of support and advice from the lovely ladies on here.  Sorry can't be much help not sure what a round block mammoplasty is I had single mastectomy with ANC.  I know it is very scary just take one step at a time. All the best and take care Sending virtual hugs Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Round block mammoplasty

Posts.Content: Hi I was the same although I think for me I wanted to get things done while I was feeling well as I knew later on I wouldn't feel like doing it.  All the best with your chemo Tracey x
Posts.Title: cemo

Posts.Content: Definitely reccommended it really gave me a boost during chemo and met some fantastic and amazing people and have never had as much make-up lol.
Posts.Title: 'Look good, feel better' session

Posts.Content: After deciding against recon for the time being I am trying my new adhesive prosthesis for the first time today feels kind of wierd but I am sure I will get used to it although I know I will def want recon at some point just not now.
Posts.Title: New prosthesis

Posts.Content: Hi I found FEC the worse one was really ill with it on the first cycle threw up for 4 days but on the second cycle the only thing that stopped me from being sick was to have a shringe driver which was great it gave me anti sickness meds 24 hours a day, hang in there remember there is medication for everything don't put up with problems they can be sorted.  I found TAX a doddle after fec. All the best Hugs, Tracey
Posts.Title: fec

Posts.Content: Hi Tracy, congrats on finishing chemo we all go on not only physical but emotional journey when I finished chemo did get side effects but didn't last long.  I think for us its emotional for us to finish chemo but also scary that we are not going to hospital appointments with me in a strange way I missed chemo.  When I finished rads I cried on the way home after last treatment I thought OMG I have beaten cancer. Sending you hugs hope you feel better soon, your not alone All the best Tracey x
Posts.Title: End of chemo .. Why am I so low ??

Posts.Content: I have always got it before as I am the only carer for my son who has cerebal palsy
Posts.Title: REFUSING TO LET ME HAVE THE FLU JAB

Posts.Content: Hi I only got as far as receptionist maybe that was the problem its costing me 12.99 at boots but worth it if it keeps me well I work for agency so if I go off sick I don't get paid Thanks for the hug. Tracey x
Posts.Title: REFUSING TO LET ME HAVE THE FLU JAB

Posts.Content: Hi Most people kept telling me that I was being brave but didn't feel it inside sometimes I would just have a good cry.  I was devastated at the thought of losing my hair but when it happened it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be and I have a wilg that looks ok but will be glad when my hair comes back. Now I am half way through chemo and doing ok even managed to keep running on my good weeks. All the best for the rest of your treatment Tracey xx
Posts.Title: New to all this

Posts.Content: hI I went to the doctors to try and get the flu jab as I only finished cancer treatment in June and as I work as a healthcare assistant in the community to older people but the doctors told me that I wasn't eligible for the flu jab think its disgusting
Posts.Title: REFUSING TO LET ME HAVE THE FLU JAB

Posts.Content: I am nearly 2 years post chemo and it took a good 12-18 months for my nails to look totally normal I put nail varnish on to cover them up. All the best Tracey x
Posts.Title: nails....

Posts.Content: Yeah thats what I though but apparently not on both counts getting one at boots now tommorrow
Posts.Title: REFUSING TO LET ME HAVE THE FLU JAB

Posts.Content: Hi The doctors have just rung me saying that I am entitled to the flu jab and they will book me an appointment to have it next week when they get the vaccine told them I have had it from Boots now so they are going to refund me the cost of what I paid for flu jab
Posts.Title: REFUSING TO LET ME HAVE THE FLU JAB

Posts.Content: I was really sick on fec but wasn't as bad on Tax hardly felt sick at all was ok till day 5/6 got achy legs and fingers but was fine with pain killers and felt wiped out on day 5/6 then started to improve good luck.  Found Tax easier than fec. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: Hi Sheilay I know how you feel this last two weeks while I have been waiting for my mx have been so stressful at times Iike you I've had sleepless nights but now I feel a bit better as mx is on Tuesday so will be glad to get shut of it then just chemo and rads. All the best Hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week- waiting for biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi was just wondering how long after having LD flap recon did you wait before you could drive again
Posts.Title: Driving after LD flap recpnstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Angel Please don't feel alone we are all their with you and ready to support your through your journey, we have all been there I know how you feel even with friends and family around me I felt all on my own, but the lovely ladies on this site got me through it don't know how I would have coped without them. All the best hang in there Virtual Hugs Tracey
Posts.Title: feel alone

Posts.Content: Hi I am thinking of having a tattoo of an angel and was just wondering if anyone else has had one after having BC and if yes how long did they wait after treatment was finished Tracey
Posts.Title: Tattoo after BC

Posts.Content: Hi Too rite live life to the full just got myself a caring in the community job due to start anytime now my CRB check has come back.  Got an appt with onc next week so will ask her what she thinks about getting tattoo.  Doing a genetic course with OU needed to know how my cancer started in the first place on a cellular level. All the best everyone, take care Tracey
Posts.Title: Tattoo after BC

Posts.Content: Hi Thats lovely debbiegabs Take care Tracey
Posts.Title: Tattoo after BC

Posts.Content: Hi Annie Yes feeling ok just feel like I want to get on with it now, my ONC has told me to take half a tablet 8 hours before my chemo to keep me calm, although I am still worried about having to inject myself but the ladies on here say injections are ok.  Hope it continues to go well for you, Beara and everyone else having chemo and also ladies having other treatments. Kiera
Posts.Title: Hello, I'm a newbie

Posts.Content: Hi Gills Yeah I've now got my tattoo I have a butterfly with the breast cancer ribbon going through it, everyone loves it and its on my right shoulder. But thanks for your comment anyway Tracey
Posts.Title: Tattoo after BC

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy Welcome to the club no one wants to join, you will get plenty of support and everyone in here are so friendly.  I am starting chemo next Tues so getting a bit scared now I know the date but just got to get on with it and I will be fine. All the best with your treatment Hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: Hello, I'm a newbie

Posts.Content: Hi I was just saying today that I have been lucky and havnt had to have it drained but now have noticed that I think my chest has swollen a bit above where my boob used to be and have had pins and needles not sure if this is normal
Posts.Title: My Seroma won't go away

Posts.Content: Hi You haven't said what chemo your are having but I had gel nails whilst on chemo and they were fine and some onc say nail varnish can help protect your nails from going funny colour or falling off when on Taxatore. All the best for Tues, take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: Gel nails - chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi I am so sorry for what you are going through it is a horrible thing to go through.  The first week was definitely the worst week of my life, I did anything I could just to take my mind off it but everytime I thought about it I started crying that first week went so slow.  Last week I was diagnosed with breast cancer but I felt a bit better because I had prepared myself that it might be cancer and feel better now I know what is going to happen and am just taking one step at a time. The breast care nurses have been brilliant with me and the support people give you on here is amazing. All the best Kiera
Posts.Title: advice please

Posts.Content: Good luck sweetcheeks with your results today I know how you feel I've got an appointment at hospital with surgeon at 3.15 and feeling really nervous. Kiera
Posts.Title: advice please

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy It is early days after finishing chemo and the affects last for a while so give yourself time, I am 1 year post chemo now waiting for reconstruction at the end of the year and feeling good, since finishing chemo I  now work as a carer, training to be an assistant beaver scout leader, got camp this weekend so that should be interesting lol training for race for life and have even got a date with a nice man on sun Hang in there you will soon have even better life Virtual hugs Tracey
Posts.Title: Chemo after affects

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa Yeah it is that was what I was on, I was told to choose a dark colour a lot of people wear black, I wore dark blue and definitely protected my nails.  It is especially important when you are on the t part do fec-t Hope this helps  Tracey
Posts.Title: Gel nails - chemo?

Posts.Content: I have a tattoo of a butterfly with cancer ribbon going through it on my left shoulder.  My Onc told me I couldnt have a tattoo on the side I had my nodes removed so just check before you have one on that side
Posts.Title: Tattoos

Posts.Content: Hi I had mastectomy 2012 followed by 6 sessions of fec-t chemo and had 15 sessions of radiotherapy which started 4 weeks after finishing chemo had to go everyday for 3 weeks. All the best with your treatment.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy Advice

Posts.Content: Its my sister that doesn't seem to want to know for some reason she keeps saying thats she's is always thinking about me and that she will ring me but she never does even when she promised me on my birthday.  My best friend is more like a sister she has been there 100% for me all the way through. When I went out with my friends for a meal at lunchtime I was wearing my bandana as it was warm in there, but when I got up I noticed this woman was staring at me with her mouth open couldn't believe it should have taken it off then she would have got a shock.
Posts.Title: How to deal with how people react

Posts.Content: Hi Mccaan I know how you feel I have just finished FEC and am due to have my 1st Tax on the 19th hopefully it will be better than the FEC as I have been really sick with that one and felt really tired on 3rd one so I am hoping TAX will be better but I'm still nervous about it. Good luck for Weds hopefully it goes well for you. All the best Tracey x
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: Got an appt with my onc on Thursday think maybe might be the last one although not sure but def going to mention the pain in my joints I'm having with Tamoxifen (well I'm blaming it on Tamoxifen) maybe she can suggest some painkillers although now I have fallen off my bike and landed in a concrete post so now I am black and blue and am def sore lol but keep popping the nurofen. Tracey
Posts.Title: Appt with ONC Thursday

Posts.Content: Hi,  I have been through mastectomy,  chemo, rads and reconstruction and its amazing how much strength you get from the support from from friends and family, although you are feeling useless I bet your mum is glad your there supporting her.  You may find it more useful to post in the carers support group, I wish you and your mum all the best. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Newbie - feeling useless

Posts.Content: Hi I agree with Kate if your not satisfied demand answers don't ever feel like your pestering it is your health.  I used to have pain under the ribs and one day I got up and heard them pop I was scared so I went to doctors but everything was fine and all scans were clear. All the best Tracey x
Posts.Title: so confused

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I had shringe driver for every cycle of chemo as it was the only way to control sickness it was great so glad I had it, it was brilliant.  I only used it for the first 10 days and had 7 day anti sickness injection before each cycle. Hope this helps, anything u want to know just ask let me know how u get on Tracey
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for sickness?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa So glad your feeling better and able to eat and drink and glad it's doing the trick for you its no fun feeling sick. Take care Tracey
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for sickness?
Saw this and it made me smile

Posts.Content: Hi With first fec I was so ill that had the shringe driver for next two cycles it was great, had 7 day anti sickness injection before I had chemo then came home with shringe driver and district nurse used to come and change it every day for 10 days.  Would highly recommend it, all the best. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for anti sickness meds

Posts.Content: Hi I am feeling really depressed at the moment keep getting really emotional and tearful, it is nearly a year since I got my cancer diagnosis and really dreading my mammogram next month its just like its happening all over again. Tracey x
Posts.Title: FEELING REALLY DEPRESSED

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Thankyou so much for all your support feel a bit better today going to go to see a counsillor see how that helps feel a little better today after going to the gym although still don't feel too grreat.  I was doing really well got a job, back to taekwondo and back to the gym and this last few days it hit me just what a hard year it has been for me (and us all) and I know I should be grateful that I am still here and stop whinging. Its not helping that I'm not really coping with my body image after mx.  Some people come up to me and say you've got a fantastic body or I wished I had your body I tell them really you don't.  I really hate my body can't wait till I can have reconstruction late next year. Thankyou for understanding Tracey x
Posts.Title: FEELING REALLY DEPRESSED

Posts.Content: Hi I had mx in 2012 seems a distant memory now,  I bought pj's with buttons down the front that were easy to get on and off, I think I lived in my pj's for the first few days.  I found that the pain seemed to be worse where the drain was as I kept forgetting I had got it in and kept tugging it. All the best take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: MX on Friday

Posts.Content: Hi Joanna Had a bad week at work also going to go to taekwondo tonight that should help and theres a man there that who gives me a cuddle if I really need one sometimes it is really hard being a single mum especially with everything going on at the moment but your right I need to get back in a positive frame of mind. Yes the get drunk sounds like a good plan lol Thankyou Joanna for your support Tracey x
Posts.Title: FEELING REALLY DEPRESSED

Posts.Content: I went to the gym yesterday for the first time since I had my mx.  I was really suprised how much energy I had and so was my friend, I found it easier to do some running than before I had the op which is great, but maybe this was due to being lighter on one side. I have so far got 2 of my friends to do race for life with me and we are going to dress up in pink tutu and angel wings.  I am hoping to keep running two out of the three weeks between chemo sessions but we will see.
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee Thankyou I have done the race for life for about 6 years, the atmosphere is fantastic and your raising money for such a gud cause as well, although like everyone else I never thought I would get BC. Hopefully you will be back in the pool soon thats definitely something to look forward to.  Well done to all the blue dolphins who have got into the pool and good luck to all those who are waiting to go swimming. Kiera
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: I went to the gym yesterday for the first time since I had my mx.  I was really suprised how much energy I had and so was my friend, I found it easier to do some running than before I had the op which is great, but maybe this was due to being lighter on one side. I have so far got 2 of my friends to do race for life with me and we are going to dress up in pink tutu and angel wings.  I am hoping to keep running two out of the three weeks between chemo sessions but we will see.
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: I'm finding it hard to cope anymore had a single mastectomy and look disgusting and to top it all found out my bf was cheating with someone who has a normal body can't blame him really, don't see the point anymore just keep crying
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies thank you so much for your support all your comments are really helpful.  Have got appt with plastic surgeon next weds to talk about reconstruction and although I know it won't be the same it will give me so much confidence to have two boobs again.  I want the one where they take it off your tummy forgot what its called and have been to keeping abreast where I have seen the results on  other women really can't wait but had radiotherapy end of june last year so won't be able to have it till July. I was confused about bf cos I met him after I had mx and he always knew I only had one boob and said it didn't bother him and that he was looking forward to having a good 2014 with me so don't get it so I guess I'm better off without him and leaving him in 2013 lol. Thanks so much feel a lot better now and I have some amazing friends especially my best friend Take care everyone and thanks Tracey
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Canton I am glad things are going well for you with your husband that is great to hear.  I have learned as one door closes another 1 opens and today it was first day of work and went to someone with advanced dementia and I thought what am I moaning about I should be feeling lucky
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee Thankyou I have done the race for life for about 6 years, the atmosphere is fantastic and your raising money for such a gud cause as well, although like everyone else I never thought I would get BC. Hopefully you will be back in the pool soon thats definitely something to look forward to.  Well done to all the blue dolphins who have got into the pool and good luck to all those who are waiting to go swimming. Kiera
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: I was hoping that Tax would be better although I can't really moan about FEC as apart from the sickness for the first few days havn't had any other side effects and have even managed to get back in to the gym
Posts.Title: Taxol Herceptin then FEC

Posts.Content: Well done kittycat you have done really well, the first year we did race for life after my friends mum died of cancer my friend was really crying at the end but she was glad she did it and I know I am going to be emotional this year hopefully not too much though but we will see.
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi Lynda Thanks for the advice I never thought of a cushion thats a good idea although mine shouldnt be too bad as I dont have big boobs but will definitely take a cushion and wet wipes also taking my mp4 and earplugs to keep me entertained. After I had my sentinel biopsy op they put me on a ward for a day and it was so hot i'm deinitely only taking summer pajamas and im glad I will only be in for one night. I will have to be patient only just over a week to wait for my op now. All the best with the rest of your treatment Kiera sending u hugs
Posts.Title: Can't wait to have my mx operation

Posts.Content: Well done kittycat you have done really well, the first year we did race for life after my friends mum died of cancer my friend was really crying at the end but she was glad she did it and I know I am going to be emotional this year hopefully not too much though but we will see.
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi I have said that from the moment they took it out and my scans came clear that I am recovering from cancer and that my chemo and radiotherapy are there just my insurance policy.  Although I was diagnosed with BC I never did find out what grade or name of cancer I had though but the main thing is that I got rid of the little bugger Kiera
Posts.Title: When does survival start officially?

Posts.Content: I can't believe I am saying this but I just can't wait to have my mx operation, I always was worried about losing my breast but now I just want it off as quick as possible and to start chemo although I know I'm gonna go through hell but I am hoping I can continue to go to gym through my treatment although I know I probably won't have the energy to run like I do now. I had sentinel node biopsy last Thurs recovery wasn't too bad but now it seems to have swelled up and I am wondering if I have got infection or if it is the cancer getting worse or maybe its just in my head.
Posts.Title: Can't wait to have my mx operation

Posts.Content: Hi I also had mx and ANC and now I have just started FEC.  I'm on day 13 after my first chemo and although I was sick for the first few days I havn't had any problems since and have been to the gym today for a good workout even managed a run on the treadmill. All the best hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: Taxol Herceptin then FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Mx is mastectomy and ANC is auxillary node clearance.  Yes I was actually sick couldn't keep anything down but they say they will give me stronger anti sickness drugs next time so hopefully will be better, but everyone is different. All the best x Kiera
Posts.Title: Taxol Herceptin then FEC

Posts.Content: Thank everyone for your comments yeah haven't got any room for any sleeze bags in my life he is way in the past.  I totally agree with highland mum that Hudson that is a strong message and that you are an amazing person and that I just need to get a grip thank you for your message
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi First of all I am sorry that you have to join this club, but welcome you will get a lot of support from this site and really gets you through.  I had mx in dec 12 followed by chemo and rads and now on Tamoxifen.  All I can say the waiting is the worst bit once you get a plan of treatment its easier as you have something to focus on just take one step at a time. I wish you all the best friend request me if you want, this is a great site for support or even if you just want to have a rant Virtual hugs Tracey
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with breast cancer,need support

Posts.Content: Hi I was due to go on the waiting list for DIEP reconstruction but surgeon says I can't have it as don't have enough fat but she could do ld flap reconstruction instead but don't know what to do as I had set my heart on the DIEP one.  Its hard decision part of me says why bother but the other half is telling me at least I would be able to wear the tops I want and regular bras Tracey
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Back home after sentinel node biopsy they said the op went well although I was really nervous but all the staff at the theatre were great.  Not feeling too sore at the moment thank god now just got to wait for my results but should get them on weds.
Posts.Title: Glad to be back home after op

Posts.Content: Hi After a couple of weeks with depression finally have positive thoughts its been a year since diagnosis on Thursday but not going to let it get me down.  I am going to join either cubs or scouts as a helper and have a job as a home carer which I absolutely love and have got a few challenges for me to look forward to next year including getting my 2nd degree black belt and would love to do the moon walk Hope everyone is doing ok Love to all of you Tracey x
Posts.Title: Back from negative to positive thoughts

Posts.Content: Hi Thankyou ladies for your good wishes thats one step nearer to getting rid of this cancer will try not to worry about it till weds.  I'm prepared for the worst although hoping for the best either way I know I will get through this. Kiera
Posts.Title: Glad to be back home after op

Posts.Content: Hi Hazel Welcome to the club none of us wants to join.  I was diagnosed with BC in Nov 2012 had a mx and ANC.  I have had some very dark moments where I kept having panic attacks especially at night but it really helped having lovely ladies on here to talk to that knew exactly what I was going through and were very supportive. I am now far more positive now just got to get through chemo and rads so you do get through it somehow and will get a lot of support on this site. All the best Hugs Kiera
Posts.Title: hello

Posts.Content: My mammogram didnt show anything abnormal and the ultrasound only showed some calcification near the nipple which they said sometimes can be a sign of cancer so they did a biopsy.  I went back for results a week later they told me that it was cancer but they didn't think that it had gone to lymph nodes.  It was only when I had surgery that they discovered had 3cm tumour and had spread to 5 lymph nodes.  The care I received was excellent had SN biopsy and mastectomy and ANC within a month.
Posts.Title: Delay with Diagnoses

Posts.Content: Hi I came out with drain in didn't have it out till 6 days post op, I found the drain more painful then the mastectomy as kept catching it and kept forgetting to do exercises which are important although I think because I am a single mum to 3 boys so think I was doing them anyway. I think it was easier as I had right breast off and am left handed, didn't go out with drain although It would have been good for Halloween lol All the best Tracey
Posts.Title: Mastectomy -1day to go

Posts.Content: Hi Benja I have got my sentinel node biopsy op on Thurs so mite be in a similar position soon, every little pain I get I'm convinced I've developed another tumour and its hard to get it out of my head. Hope u feel more positive soon all the best Kiera
Posts.Title: Inflamed Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Thankyou ladies I feel a bit better now and they have given me a tablet to take before I go for my chemo to keep me calm.  I am going on Tuesday at 9.30 so at least I'm not worrying all day. Thanks Kiera
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous of my first fec chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki Thankyou good luck for tomorrow will be thinking about you the onc has given me a tablet that I can take before I go to chemo to calm me down.  I am lucky there just gonna use a catheta with me. All the best for tomorrow. Hugs Kiera x
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous of my first fec chemo

Posts.Content: Now that I know the date and time I have to go to the hosp getting very nervous now, I know if anyones going to be sick it will be me.  I told the onc they will need to give me the strongest anti sickness drugs. I get travel sick, sea sick and was sick all the way through the pregnancy with my 3rd child so have got no chance of not being sick with chemo.  Any tips on what helps would be appreciated
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous of my first fec chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I was the same was worried about losing my hair but once it happened it wasn't too bad I used to walk round the house with bald head kids didn't mind asked them if I could have some of theirs,  I had to laugh a few times when answered door with no scarf on I think I gave some people a shock lol I am 1 year post chemo have a nice head of hair just had it highlighted everyone says I look younger so thats gr8 but it has come back curly and I know I shouldn't but sometimes think when I'm having bad hair day it was so easy when I didn't have any or when I had just a bit. All the best to you lovely ladies Tracey
Posts.Title: Hair worries

Posts.Content: Hi Does anyone know if the numbness in your fingers ever comes back as its making it difficult to pick up things or open packets and especially now as I have got a job as a home carer Many thanks Tracey x
Posts.Title: Numbness in fingers

Posts.Content: Hi Yeah I am enjoying the calm waters now feeling much better.  I am having to have physio on my ankle once a week at the hospital as I have got an inflamed tendon hopefully will be better soon although I have got a fit physio lol.  Got to wait a year till I can have my reconstruction can't wait.   Yeah gonna get some scissors and first aid kit, coins is hard I have to push them off the desk lol Hope you are ok Tracey x
Posts.Title: Numbness in fingers

Posts.Content: Hi I felt the same as you used to have bad panic attacks at nights so bad that I thought I was having a heart attack.  I am a single mum to 3 boys aged 9, 17 and 15 so was panicking that I wasn't going to be around for them growing up. I had cancer in my nodes but my scans were clear have now done chemo and am on last week of rads and getting my life back on track I still have the odd wobble but most of the time I'm fine. although I do worry about every little pain but I think thats only natural. All the best, take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: Feeling Guilty Now

Posts.Content: Hi I am due to have my final TAX on Tuesday, on the first TAX my legs really ached from day 5 for 2 days so is completely normal on the second one it was easier.  I took anadin joint pain and that seemed to do the trick. Tracey x
Posts.Title: 1st tax and legs ache

Posts.Content: Hi I found a lump went to gp he said there was nothing wrong with me but luckily he referred me to  hospital had mammogram that was clear had ultrasound that showed calcification and biopsy that came back that I had cancer lump was grade 2 3 mm and also 5 lymph nodes were affected glad they did ultrasound. Had to have mx and full node clearance, not sure I totally trust mammogram All the best everyone Tracey x
Posts.Title: An uneasy question to ask about a previous mammogram

Posts.Content: Hello Heather I had LD flap in April it is really hard I know when you can't do anything much and you are sore and tired most of the time but hang on in there it is so worth it.  I went out in London and 3 months after reconstruction and was on top of the world as I could wear my Favourite low cut top and actually had cleavage. All the best will be thinking about you, take care Tracey
Posts.Title: Quadrantectomy plus LD Flap

Posts.Content: Hi Mumbly I know its a tough decision I decided to have chemo and am now on my second FEC, time has gone so quick and by the end of the month I will be half way through my chemo.  I think of the chemo as my insurance policy as I will do anything to reduce my chances of getting it again. Like others have said it does take a long time to complete the treatment but I am looking as this year as my fix it year and then my new improved life starts in 2014.
Posts.Title: Chemo yes/no

Posts.Content: Happy new year to everyone hopefully 2013 will be a gud year.  It looks like your going to have an awesome year SaxxyD.  I am thinking of going to see my mother-in-law in France in the summer and maybe have a day at a spa for my birthday depending how it fits in with boot camp and tanning.  All the best to everyone Kiera
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Hi Thankyou so much ladies for your support and advice you've made  my day a lot better and helped me to put things into perspective nice to have you here I would find it harder to cope without this site. Thankyou Anita for your comments and its a good way of looking at it that chemo and radiotherapy are your insurance policy. Hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Finding it hard to cope

Posts.Content: Hi Went to see surgeon today got mx booked for 4th December can't wait to get rid of it then they will find how far it has gone I am a nervous wreck at the moment can't think of anything else.  They said will have to have chemo and rads
Posts.Title: Finding it hard to cope

Posts.Content: Hi Debra Thankyou so much its nice to know that other people have been through it and come out the other side really well.  Congrats on getting the all clear that is brilliant I bet you are relieved time to celebrate. Kiera
Posts.Title: Finding it hard to cope

Posts.Content: I think a few sniffles is fine as long as there is no high temp or sneezing and blood work is ok.  I am due 5th chemo Tuesday so hopefully blood tests will be ok as I have had bad cold. Good luck for Thursday Tracey x
Posts.Title: Cold vs 1st Chemo??

Posts.Content: Got results of my biopsy today they said that they found cancer in one of my lymph nodes so will now have to have chemo as well as mx keep thinking I've got it all over my body.  Going to see the surgeon tomorrow hopefully will get me in for the op next week really finding it hard to cope now.
Posts.Title: Finding it hard to cope

Posts.Content: I am due to have implants at the end of the year just wondered if anyone has had any problems with them leaking etc Many thanks Tracey x
Posts.Title: Breast implants

Posts.Content: Hi ladies Thank you for your comments never thought of putting bra under my costume will choose a quiet time then if it goes wrong hopefully no one will notice. Will let you know how i get on Tracey
Posts.Title: Swimming with prosthesis

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Just wondered has anyone been swimming with prosthesis as I am going tomorrow just a bit worried about it but used to love swimming Tracey
Posts.Title: Swimming with prosthesis

Posts.Content: Hi They said because I haven't got enough fat on my tummy.  They have offered me LD one with implant and expander, the wine and chocolate option sounds like the best one lol
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not

Posts.Content: Hi Davina I have been to the keeping abreast support group and have now decided not to go for the reconstruction I am going to have an adehesive prosthetic boob for now and see how I go, don't want to have to take another year out of my life on a procedure I might not like although looking at pictures it looks really good, my plastic surgeon was really negative too.  The BCN also said just because I am saying no now doesnt mean I can't change my mind in the future. I am the same hate not being able to wear the tops that I want or go and buy a n ice lingerie set All the best Let me know how u get on
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not

Posts.Content: Hi People tell me that they don't move at all as I needed to know as do a lot of running and would hate it to fall off during race that would be embarrassing I should be getting it next week so will let you know how I get on with them Tracey
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not

Posts.Content: Hi I am going to the kings lynn one at Q.E Hospital on weds
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not

Posts.Content: I can't decide whether to have recon or not as they have refused to do the one that I want the DIEP which would have been gr8 and the other option seems like second best as I had set my heart on DIEP. On the one hand it would be nice to have two boobs so I could wear what I wanted, but on the other hand they said its gonna take a year before its complete and feel like I've wasted enough time on getting better.  I am thinking about going to keeping abreast meeting on Weds. Tracey
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I was just wondering how long everyone waited for their scan results I had mine on Tuesday and its driving me crazy waiting for the results
Posts.Title: Scan results

Posts.Content: Hi  Yes it is the pits don't think I will ever get used to the waiting.  My consutant said as far as hes aware hes got all the cancer out so the scans are just for reassurance fingers x hes right.
Posts.Title: Scan results

Posts.Content: Hi all I know I have no right to moan as some people have gone through a lot over xmas, but gotta go to hosp this morning to get drained seem to make me feel a bit breathless but that mite be just in my head although seems better when I dont have my bra on. Happy new year everyone and hope 2013 is going to be a better year.
Posts.Title: Back to hospital

Posts.Content: Hi Kipper107 Sorry that you are having a bad time but its true the treatments do go quick it doesn't seem that long ago since I had my first chemo and now I'm on my final chemo tomorrow. All the best take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: All new and very scared

Posts.Content: It went really well feel much better now and they also told me that my scans were clear so time for champagne thank you santa
Posts.Title: Back to hospital

Posts.Content: Hi SaxxyD and Wendy Thanks a lot I will be getting wine out later and have even bought a lottery ticket while my lucks in. Kiera
Posts.Title: Back to hospital

Posts.Content: Hi Ali so sorry to hear that I know you wanted better news and you must feel awful.  I had mastectomy and now had reconstruction.  Everyone wants the least amount of treatment to get better. All the best sending virtual hugs xx Tracey
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: Hi Ali so sorry to hear that I know you wanted better news and you must feel awful.  I had mastectomy and now had reconstruction.  Everyone wants the least amount of treatment to get better. All the best sending virtual hugs xx Tracey
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: Hi Eider All the best tomorrow hopefully it will be the last draining for you I feel a lot better after my draining. kiera
Posts.Title: Back to hospital
